title: Amazing piece of software
comment: Have used this on various old phones with varying degrees of success. Generally, the configuration on one phone will not work as well with a different one so a bit of testing is required with each model of phone used.  Overall, the features available are incredible for a free app, would gladly pay for it.  Users giving one star feedback and calling the app junk have to realise it is not designed for users who do not want to experiment with the settings. It's free! Give the guy a break.

title: New Problem
comment: Latest version, 6 may 2014, takes one picture and then stop, using Samsung ace duos. I had used MobileWebCam for a year now until the 6th of may. Now it is not working, sadlly.  May 14 release, the problem still exists. Please note, the ace duos has one rear camera, and I set up MobileWebCam to upload images to my dropbox.

title: Flaky piece of junk
comment: This doesn't work very well on my ancient HTC 4G (Sprint) phone which I'd like to use as a webcam -- it has many java.lang.NullPointerExceptions. I'm not an android developer, but the code is open source on code google com. If this worked, I'd pay several dollars for it -- a dedicated WiFi webcam with fewer features costs more than $30.
Please report the crashes or send me logs if possible. I have not every device to test but NullPointerExceptions with a line number reported can be fixed in minutes ...

title: Horribly buggy
comment: Can't change image size from 320x200, upload to SFTP stops workung after some time ('No such file/directory'). Pretty sure the app also forgets settings sometines ... Horrible software... (On Google Nexus Droid)  Update: I ended up saving the images to the phone which worked for a while. Sometimes the app didn't take pictures at the scheduled time though. Anyway, now the app started taking photos in 320x240 only. Can't take larger images... its ridicolous...
Would be nice to receive a log from your phone so the errors can be fixed. Did you check you do not have "Custom" picture size enabled - then 320x240 would be the default ...

title: Great app!
comment: I have been searching for an application to use my webcam and my android device for remote surveillance for some time and I found only crappy software, until I found this app... It has almost everything I was looking for, tons of configuration options, and it's totally free. Many thanks to the author!
is it possible to change refresh time that it takes two pictures each second?
You can put in 0 ... then it will try as fast as possible. But maybe a video app is more what you need then as most cameras will take more than a second alone for focus ...

title: What an app!
comment: I knew what I wanted to achieve when I set out looking for IP cameras initially but thought we would have problems with firewalls in the office and then someone recommended this. Can't find anything that hasn't been covered by the author, everything I can think I'd want it to do has already been thought of - including Dropbox upload, auto-restart, motion detection, etc.! And the suggestion to use partially working phones is precisely what I had in mind (as we sell phones and have some with faulty earpieces or partly cracked glass). Best of all, it's free - would have paid for this functionality as it saves me buying an IP camera(s) and the time and grief of configuring it.

title: Feature rich, can fit many different needs
comment: My first impression of the app was very positive, having many options to meet different use cases. Then, after testing long time-lapse recordings, I found out it would sometimes crash, but that is potentially due to the old device I am using. After some tweaking with the settings, updating the Android version and an app bug fixing release, it now seems to be working well. The developer is dedicated to the project and making sure it works for as many devices as possible.  An idea for improvement would be to have combination of setups: being able to define different picture (tab) settings and different activity (tab) settings for different upload (tab) settings, so that for example you could define http/ftp uploads at low resolution every few seconds, high-res imaging to ftp less often and motion detection/intent events to e-mail, all running at once.  In any case, great work!

title: fast
comment: good app

title: The Best WebCam I Ever Used
comment: I have tried more than 10 different webcam-like apps. MobileWebCam is most significant one. You might stick on it as I did for the reasons below: 1. provide the photo to you in various ways: http/ftp/dropbox and so on 2. make itself survive by many means: auto-reboot the phone(rooted), autostart when reboot, auto-retry after failures, aware of the poor camera and network-bandwidth 3. custom the photo you will see: the filename(serialno / datetime), imprint textlabel(battery status, datetime, gps(both imprint and EXIF), resolution and quality), customed trigger(timely, motion detected, keep alive) 4. some other amazing functions, such as:make AVI by the photo, clean&clear web based management  All in all, MobileWebCam is the one I need.

title: Needs improvements
comment: This is a good little app, but it needs work.  First off, the thumbnail pics gotta go.  We need to see a full size pic!  Also, there needs to be a rapid fire option so we don't have to keep choosing which app we wanna send the pic to.  We can just snap snap snap snap snap to our hearts' desire.  I hope to see improvements in the next version.

title: Not really working for larger image sizes
comment: I'm uploading pictures to a FTP server, which works well on the lowest image setting. However, when using larger image sizes it says "not enough memory to process image" even though I've turned off all image processing I could find. The web server is nice for viewing error messages, but sometimes nothing is displayed in the log and no pictures are taken. Needs work - especially in the settings department, where the default values are weird and it is not really clear what's enabled and not.

title: Promising.. but not on Inspire
comment: Sends pictures to web server. But on HTC Inspire running Android 2.2.1, camera hangs after a few shots. After killing MobileWebCam, the camera is unavailable until restart. I couldn't report this using the unresponsive app dialogue since the phone is too hung up to allow this. The PHP text provided in the Overview is inaccurate: the script is missing an opening '<?' A small HowTo would be nice to avoid more bad reviews, but it works fine for some, I'm sure. 3 stars off for not working for me; sorry
Not ready for use needs lots of work
